description:

title: How Old Will We Be In Heaven?
description:
On the subject of our age in heaven, proper scholarship does not allow us to be authoritative with a precise age. However, the scriptures provide some clues that are worth a closer look. 

For example, when we read the account of the creation of Adam, and then Eve, it appears from the scriptures that they were created with a discernible age and in the prime of life. 

In today‚Äôs study, ‚ÄòHow Old Will We Be In Heaven‚Äô, we will answer these 5 questions:

Is the Doctrine of the Rapture Biblical? 3 Compelling Reasons to Believe!
description:
In my 50 years of carefully and systematically studying the Bible, I am thoroughly convinced that the doctrine of the rapture is not only securely established in the scripture, I am equally  convinced that the rapture will take place before God‚Äôs outpouring of wrath before the seven years of tribulation.

As long as I continue to see the increasing assault against the doctrine of the rapture, I will continue to answer the questions and confusions that are created.

In our study today, I would like to point out three significant biblical concepts that provide secure evidence for the doctrine of the rapture, as well as provide three glaring problems for those who disavow the doctrine of the rapture:

Problem #1 - The Scripture teaches Christ‚Äôs return in two distinct and separate events.

Problem #2 - Jesus described His return to, the days of Noah and Lot.

Problem #3 - Every example in the Scripture provides evidence for the righteous being separated and spared from God‚Äôs wrath.

------------------

If I Tithe, Why Am I Not Prospering? The Top 10 Reasons Why Christians Do Not Prosper
description:
"Prosperity" is a biblical word, it is not a "bad" word. What is biblical prosperity? Biblical prosperity is defined as having an abundance of resources to fully accomplish God‚Äôs will for one‚Äôs life, and to serve others.

According to the scripture, biblical prosperity is a multifaceted covenant that is rooted in God‚Äôs provision and purpose that not only includes material wealth, but also includes spiritual, physical, emotional, and relational strength.

Prosperity isn‚Äôt a vending machine ‚Äî it‚Äôs the fruit of relationship, obedience, and timing. If you‚Äôve been giving and not prospering, ask the Holy Spirit to search your heart, align your life, and trust that God is faithful to reward those who seek Him (Hebrews 11:6).

Christians who do not manage their money well may struggle to prosper because Scripture teaches that stewardship and diligence are essential to experiencing God‚Äôs blessing.

In today‚Äôs study we will learn‚Ä¶

What is biblical prosperity?

Why do the wicked prosper while godly people do not?

Does the Bible promise material prosperity to all believers?

How can I get from "barely getting by" to "having an abundance"?

‚Ä¶and the top 10 reasons why Christians do not prosper!

------------------

Can You Answer These 6 Questions About the Resurrection of Jesus?
description:
It's not wrong for people to have questions about the Bible and as Christians, we are to have answers! Here are 6 Common Questions about the validity of the Resurrection of Jesus Christ along with their answers:

1. Aren't the accounts of Jesus largely fictional?
2. What if Jesus didn't die but merely fainted?
3. What if the people claiming to see Jesus alive after his death were only hallucinating?
4. What if Jesus' body was stolen from the tomb?
5. What if those looking for Jesus went to the wrong tomb?

How to Recognize the Call of God to Ministry
description:
Did you know that biblically, every person has been called first to salvation, then, every true Christian is called to ministry?

What does it mean to "be called to ministry"?

Every Christian, no. matter who you are or what you do, you are called by God to tell others about Jesus and make disciples.

Can a Woman Be a Pastor?
description:
The controversy concerning the role of women in ministry, serving as pastors, elders, deacons, and various church leadership roles continues to be aggressively  debated among respected theologians and denominational leaders.

All true Christians agree that the Bible is our final authority in all matters of faith and practice.

Therefore, on this contentious issue, it is critical that we carefully examine what the scriptures say about the biblical role of women in ministry.


1 - Are there examples of women in ministry in the Old Testament?

2 - Are there examples of women in ministry in the New Testament?

3 - Is there an equality provided for women in the New Covenant?

4 - Is there an example in the New Testament of a woman pastor?

title: Has the Tribulation Begun?
description:
According to biblical prophecy, the tribulation is a seven year period that will begin immediately following the rapture. 

This tribulation period will display the greatest display of God‚Äôs wrath and judgment in all of human history! Evil without restraint, diseases, natural, disasters, wars, the death of almost half of the world‚Äôs population, and more.

Jesus said that if God had not limited this time, (7 years x 360 = 2520 days) no one would survive the horrors and apocalyptic events. In all of that prophesied horror that is coming upon this earth, there is a blessed hope available as we will see in the scriptures today.


1. Does the Bible tell us when the tribulation begins?

title: What will happen to you when you die?
description:
What will happen to you when you die?
üôåüî•The Bible is not silent when it comes to talking about what will happen to us after we die. The Word of God makes it very clear that death is not the final part in our lives, but that it is rather only a change in location. We will either go to heaven or hell. The Bible tells us that after death, we will be judged by God! So if you haven't already, receive Christ in your heart today, because you do not know when you are going to die and your decisions of today, will determine where you will spend your eternity!üî•üôå

title: Is Divine Healing Still Relevant Today?
description:
Is Divine Healing Still Relevant Today?
üôåüî•Have you ever wondered whether or not God still heals people Today? Maybe you have gone to your local church and they tell you that healing is not a gift for today. In this video I make it clear that divine healing is a gift for today and the gift of healing is still given to people. In this video you will also see how important FAITH is when it comes to being supernaturally healed.üî•üôå

title: Go!
description: Tiff Shuttlesworth travels all over the world, fulfilling the Great Commission!

title: The Fundamentals of Fasting and Prayer
description:
Evangelist Tiff Shuttlesworth
Lost Lamb Association

In this video from his online series, Understanding Bible Prophecy, Tiff teaches the basic fundamentals of Biblical fasting and prayer. In this teaching segment, Tiff covers where fasting is spoken about by Jesus in the Bible, and goes over such questions as:
 
 As a Christian, is fasting an option?
 Is it Biblical for a pastor to ask a church family fast and pray?
 What about the Daniel Fast?
 Can I drink coffee or protein shakes on a fast?
 Can I fast with other things instead of food, such as TV or social media?
 What is the difference between fasting for weight loss and fasting Biblically?
 How long should I fast?
 How do I end a fast?

The key Scriptures for this message:
Matthew 6:5-18

You can watch Tiff live on Fridays, 12 noon EST https://www.facebook.com/LostLambAssociation/
